CE 5362 Surface Water Modeling

The course trains engineers to practice hydrologic and hydraulic modeling in one-dimensional unsteady conditiond; and in higher sparial dimensions (2D/3D) using custom-written and professional software tools. Integration of simulation tools to examine complex systems is emphasized.

The course provides an experience in different modeling platforms(DIY, HEC-RAS, SWMM, EFDC) to answer hydrodynamic questions using non-trivial examples.

Upon successful completion of this course, the participant will have:
1. Review relevant theory for 1D dynamic wave routing.
2. Develop and code a Lax-Diffusion method for time-varying flow in an open channel and compared results with HEC-RAS unsteady and SWMM.
3. Simulate the confluence of two streams in steady and unsteady conditions (fabricated conditions) using HEC-RAS or SWMM (1D-spatial)
4. Simulate the confluence of White Oak and Buffalo Bayou in steady and unsteady conditions using HEC-RAS or SWMM (1D-spatial)
5. Simulate a large-scale (county) drainage network
6. Examine theory for 2D estuary/floodplain modeling
7. Develop a quasi-2D model using SWMM 8. Develop and code a diffusion approximation for 2D floodplain
9. Simulate selected examples using EFDC
    a). Simulate 2D steady in East Lab Flume (real flume)
    b). Simulate 2D steady White River
    c). Simulate 2D unsteady "simple estuary" with river inflow
    d). Simulate 2D unsteady San Antonio Bay with salinity tracking
